original: gang yod na sems rigs par rtsom pa dang / mchog tu 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gang yod na sems rigs par rtsom pa dang / mchog tu 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Vigor is that by which the mind is engaged in the proper activity and becomes excellent.

original: 'dir dang gi sgra dag ni skyo ba dang / rab tu dga' ba bsdus pa'i don te //
analyzed: 'dir dang gi sgra dag ni skyo ba dang / rab tu dga' ba bsdus pa'i don te //
translated: The words ‚Äúand‚Äù in the verse are meant to include discouragement and delight.

original: de gnyis ni rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir sems gcig la srid pa ma yin pas dge ba'i sa mang po pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byed pa dag las ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir sems gcig la srid pa ma yin pas dge ba'i sa mang po pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byed pa dag las ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since these two are mutually exclusive, they cannot occur together in a single mind. Therefore, it is not tenable that they are universal mental factors, and they are not mentioned in the Prakara·πáa.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngang gi sgra gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngang gi sgra gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: That is why the word ‚Äúand‚Äù occurs twice in the verse.

original: tshogs pa gnyis la de dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gnyis la de dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are found in two different collections of dharmas.

original: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par @139b ldan pa'i sems kho na ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par @139b ldan pa'i sems kho na ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they have many afflicted states‚Äù indicates that they are found only in a mind that is afflicted and that is concomitant with them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: That is why the text says,

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose that always occur in an afflicted mind.‚Äù

original: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Delusion is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'di gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is this ignorance?

original: mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is non-knowledge.

original: mi shes pa 'di gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi shes pa 'di gang zhe na /
translated: What is this non-knowledge?

original: mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is non-clarity.

original: mi gsal ba 'di yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: mi gsal ba 'di yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this non-clarity?

original: gsal ba ni shes rab yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ni shes rab yin te /
translated: Clarity is wisdom.

original: de'i phyir shes bya dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ni rmongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ni rmongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the dharma which has the characteristic of non-clarity, which is an obstruction to the understanding of objects as they are, is called delusion.

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Negligence is the non-cultivation of wholesome dharmas.

original: gang zhig yod na zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that when this exists,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ni ma rnyed pa rnams mi rnyed pa dang / rnyed pa rnams mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ni ma rnyed pa rnams mi rnyed pa dang / rnyed pa rnams mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: the non-cultivation of wholesome dharmas means not acquiring what has not been acquired and not actualizing what has been acquired.

original: bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa la gces su 'dzin pa yal bar 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa la gces su 'dzin pa yal bar 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The opposite of cultivation is called the abandonment of cherishing one's own welfare.

original: le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro ba ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la ste /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro ba ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la ste / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is in regard to virtuous actions.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the adversary of effort.

original: de ltar byas dang mi dge ba'i las la sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas dang mi dge ba'i las la sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the exertion of the mind in regard to nonvirtuous actions is not effort.

original: de ni gsung rab las le lo kho nar 'don te /
analyzed: de ni gsung rab las le lo kho nar 'don te /
translated: It is laziness alone that is mentioned in the scriptures.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni le lo kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni le lo kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has said, ‚ÄúWhatever effort there is of those outside this teaching is just laziness.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus dman pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus dman pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the inferiority of effort.

original: dman par zhugs pas ni le lo ste /
analyzed: dman par zhugs pas ni le lo ste /
translated: The inferior state is laziness.

original: de'i dngos po ni le lo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni le lo nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is laziness.

original: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lack of faith is the lack of clarity of the mind.

original: log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: It is the natural outcome of wrong views.

original: bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang / 'bras bu la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i rnam pa can no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang / 'bras bu la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i rnam pa can no // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is a mental factor that is the opposite of faith, and has the aspect of lack of conviction regarding what is true, the Three Jewels, karma, and its results.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe opposite of faith.‚Äù

original: rmugs pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩtshig snga ma snga ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin par bsams te ;
analyzed: rmugs pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / tshig snga ma snga ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin par bsams te ;
translated: What is lethargy?

original: tshig phyi ma phyi ma gnyis brjod do //üîΩg-yel ba dang mi dga' bas bskyed pa'i sems lci ba nyid ni rmugs pa ste /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma phyi ma gnyis brjod do // g-yel ba dang mi dga' bas bskyed pa'i sems lci ba nyid ni rmugs pa ste /
translated: The two latter terms are stated in order to explain the two former terms.üîΩLethargy is a heaviness of mind that is produced by laziness and lack of delight.

original: gang gis bzung na blun pa nyid kyi tshul gyis sems las su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis bzung na blun pa nyid kyi tshul gyis sems las su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is a heaviness of mind that is produced by laziness and lack of delight.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //üîΩlus kyi tshor @140a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o // lus kyi tshor @140a * //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe opposite of pliancy‚Äù because it is the opposite of pliancy.

original: ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a heaviness of body that is produced by physical pain.üîΩIt is a heaviness of body that is produced by physical pain.

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir sems kyi yin bzhin du lus kyi zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir sems kyi yin bzhin du lus kyi zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the five faculties of faith, etc., are mental but are called bodily because they arise in dependence on the physical faculties,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rmugs pa sems kyi kho na yin bzhin du dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rmugs pa sems kyi kho na yin bzhin du dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: so mental sluggishness belonging to the five collections of consciousness is called bodily sluggishness because it is supported by the physical faculties.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Excitement is an agitated mind.

original: glu dang / gar la sogs pa dang / sgeg pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan gyis sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: glu dang / gar la sogs pa dang / sgeg pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan gyis sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
translated: An agitated mind is a mind that is not calm due to singing, dancing, etc., and to the attire and ornaments of the proud.

original: gang dang ldan pas lam gol ba kho nar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas lam gol ba kho nar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
translated: Excitement is that which causes one to enter only the wrong path.

original: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharma states:üîΩWhat is excitement?

original: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par smos pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid du bshad pa rnams ma brjod pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par smos pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid du bshad pa rnams ma brjod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: It contradicts the Abhidharma because it does not mention forgetfulness, distraction, nonintrospection, incorrect attention and wrong resolve, which are explained as being the great grounds of affliction,

original: ma bstan pa'i rmugs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du brjod pa'i phyir chos mngon pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i rmugs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du brjod pa'i phyir chos mngon pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: and it mentions lethargy, which is not taught to be a great ground of affliction.

original: 'gyur ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung tshad mar byas te /
translated: The statement that it is known as the transformation of consciousness is a reference to the scriptures.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shes kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shes kyi /
translated: It is known that there are ten great grounds of affliction.

original: slob dpon gyi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi 'dod pa ste /
translated: This is the assertion of the master.

original: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: The master does not know that

original: brjed ngas pa la sogs pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin yang 'dir de dag gi nang du ma bkod do //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa la sogs pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin yang 'dir de dag gi nang du ma bkod do //
translated: forgetfulness and so on are great grounds of affliction because they are great grounds, but they are not listed here.

original: 'dir ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i ngag brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i ngag brjod par 'dod de /
translated: Here, it is speech that is intended to be accompanied by ascertainment.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams kho na brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams kho na brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, only the great grounds of affliction are intended to be mentioned.

original: rab tu byed pa dag las ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bcu dag 'don te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bcu dag 'don te /
translated: But in the treatise, the ten great grounds of affliction are mentioned,

original: nges par gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not intended to be ascertained.

original: yang ji ltar na de dag sa mang po pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de dag sa mang po pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how are they great grounds?

original: de'i phyir / dran pa nyon mongs pa kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dran pa nyon mongs pa kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúonly afflicted mindfulness,‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na shes bzhin ma yin pa yin la /üîΩyid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na shes bzhin ma yin pa yin la / yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that only afflicted wisdom is non-knowledge,üîΩonly afflicted attention is incorrect attention,

original: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho nar log par mos pa yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho nar log par mos pa yin par gzung ngo //
translated: and only afflicted aspiration is wrong aspiration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dag kho na brjed ngas pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dag kho na brjed ngas pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, means because only afflicted mindfulness, etc. are forgetfulness, etc.

original: de ltar na ni mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are four alternatives,

original: dran pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because mindfulness, etc. are of two kinds.

original: @140b mu dang po ni sa mang po pa kho na ste /
analyzed: @140b mu dang po ni sa mang po pa kho na ste /
translated: The first alternative is the universal mental factors alone,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: such as feeling, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na ste /
translated: The second is the factors that are specific to afflicted mentality alone,

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩgsum pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang yin la /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa rnams so // gsum pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang yin la /
translated: such as faithlessness, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag yin te /
translated: The third is those that are both universal mental factors and factors that are specific to afflicted mentality.

original: dran pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: These are the five, such as mindfulness, etc.

original: bzhi pa ni sa mang po bdag kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sa mang po bdag kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is those that are neither universal mental factors nor factors that are specific to afflicted mentality.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung du'i sa pa rnams dang / gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung du'i sa pa rnams dang / gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Except for those modes means except for the universal good mental factors, the specific mental factors of the small defilement category, and other factors not associated with mind.

original: de dag gi mu bzhi ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi mu bzhi ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The four possibilities are not like that.

original: ji ltar de lta ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de lta ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not like that?

original: sngar ni mu dang po tshor ba la sogs pa chos lnga mu dang po yin par bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni mu dang po tshor ba la sogs pa chos lnga mu dang po yin par bshad la /
translated: Previously, the first possibility was explained as the five factors such as feeling.

original: de lta na ni ting nge 'dzin lhag par bsnan te drug yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni ting nge 'dzin lhag par bsnan te drug yin no //
translated: But here, concentration is added to make six.

original: sngar ni mu gnyis pa le lo la sogs pa chos lnga yin la da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba lhag par bsnan te drug yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni mu gnyis pa le lo la sogs pa chos lnga yin la da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba lhag par bsnan te drug yin la /
translated: Previously, the second possibility was the five factors such as laziness. But here, distraction is added to make six.

original: sngar ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang bcas pa lnga mu gsum pa yin la da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba bor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang bcas pa lnga mu gsum pa yin la da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba bor ba bzhin no //
translated: Previously, the five factors such as distraction were the third possibility. But here, distraction is excluded, making four.

original: mu bzhi pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The fourth possibility is the same as before.

original: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste //
translated: Drowsiness does not occur in that.

original: zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni /üîΩrmugs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni / rmugs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer to that is:üîΩSluggishness is not a root of cyclic existence because it is not a root of cyclic existence like delusion and so on.

original: rmongs pa la sogs pa ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po par 'dod pas /
analyzed: rmongs pa la sogs pa ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po par 'dod pas /
translated: Since it is asserted to be a great ground of affliction because it is concomitant with all afflictions like delusion and so on,

original: de ltar de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes te /
analyzed: de ltar de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes te /
translated: it has the characteristics of a great ground of affliction. But who is at fault for not including it among the great grounds of affliction?

original: ci ngas nyes sam /
analyzed: ci ngas nyes sam /
translated: Am I at fault?

original: 'on te gang dag mi 'don pas nyes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te gang dag mi 'don pas nyes zer na /
translated: Or is it at fault for not including it?

original: gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes so //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes so //
translated: It should be included, but

original: ci'i phyir ma bton zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma bton zhe na /
translated: why was it not included?

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton to //
translated: It was not included because it is compatible with concentration.

original: ji ltar na de dang mthun pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dang mthun pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it compatible with concentration?

original: rmugs pa spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: One who engages in sluggishness quickly enters meditative attainment.

original: rmugs pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Lethargy is not a distraction.

original: de spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin myur du skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: de spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin myur du skyed par byed kyi /
translated: The practice of lethargy quickly produces concentration,

original: rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the practice of excitedness,

original: rnam par g-yeng par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is a distraction.

original: / grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: / grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid pa'o //

analyzed: yang na tshor ba dang 'du shes dag kyang rtog pa dang dpyod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te / tshor ba ni rags pa yin la /

analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis su btags pa las ni yid kyi skye mched du bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por btags pa las ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: de la dbang po la brten pa'i phyir na rten dang bcas pa dag ste /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug la brten pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di dag la dmigs pa yod pas na dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag ste /

analyzed: yul 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa re re nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa re re nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa de nyid kyi mtshan ma ni 'du shes kyis 'dzin par byed do //

original: tshor bas myong ngo //
analyzed: tshor bas myong ngo //

original: sems pas sems par byed do //
analyzed: sems pas sems par byed do //

analyzed: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gzhan dang lhan cig mnyam par ldan par gyur pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go //

analyzed: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir na mtshungs par ldan pa dag ste /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig rdzas lhag pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni snga phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo dang mtshungs par ldan par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: thams cad rnam pa gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid do //

analyzed: rdzas mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni grangs mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: sems kyi tshogs 'ga' zhig tu sems las byung ba bcu gnyis 'byung la /

analyzed: kha cig tu nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: rdzas mtshungs pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzas mtshungs pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: ji ltar sems gcig yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang re re yin te /

analyzed: rdzas rigs mthun pa gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la / rgyas pa nyid rab tu dbye ba yin pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: It says, ‚Äúalong with its extensive analysis.‚ÄùüîΩExtensive analysis is extensive analysis.

analyzed: rgyas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang lhan cig pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'o //

original: de la re zhig sems kyi rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig sems kyi rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: First, the extensive analysis of mind is:

analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //

analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyi tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyi tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The mental factors are explained from the experience of feeling up to

analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The five types of mental factors.

original: da ni sems las byung ba'i mjug thogs su bstan pa ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bshad pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod nas mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //

translated: Now, since the time has come to explain the non-associated formative forces immediately after the mental factors, desiring to state their characteristics, it says, ‚ÄúThe non-associated formative forces.

analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi 'phrod pa la sogs pa rnams bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is for the purpose of including incompatible factors and so on.

analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don du ste /

analyzed: de las tha dad pa ma yin no //

analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni ldan pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: gang dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /

original: sems dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: sems las byung ba dag ltar sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa la mi 'jug ces bya ba'i don to /

analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin zhes sems smos pa ni sems dang rigs mthun par shes par bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de dag gi sems dang @150b rigs mthun pa nyid kyang ci zhig ce na /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs kyis ni sems dang rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming mi 'thob ste /

original: de dang gang kho na mtshungs par ldan pa srid pa de kho na dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de dang gang kho na mtshungs par ldan pa srid pa de kho na dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'i /

original: gzugs dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: But it is not said to be nonassociated with form.

original: / sems las byung ba rnams kyang de dang rigs mthun pas dmigs pa med pa nges par zung bas de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang ldan pa ma yin pa smos so //
analyzed: / sems las byung ba rnams kyang de dang rigs mthun pas dmigs pa med pa nges par zung bas de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang ldan pa ma yin pa smos so //
translated: The mental factors are similar to that, and since they are definitely without an object, in order to clarify that, he says ‚Äúnon-associated. ‚Äù

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang de dang rigs mthun pa dang / dmigs pa med pa yin pas de spangs pa'i phyir 'du byed smos te /
translated: The unconditioned is similar to that, and since it is without an object, in order to exclude that, he says ‚Äúformations. ‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩ'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: For that very reason,

analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThese formations are neither associated with mind nor are they the nature of form. ‚Äù

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /

analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa kho na las ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed ces mi bya'i /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: gang dag 'du byed yin bzhin du gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin la /

analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par yang mi ldan pa de dag la ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and are not associated with mind, they are called non-associated.

original: 'dir sems smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir sems smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The mind is mentioned here because it is the principal factor.

original: sems kho na dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na ni sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kho na dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no // de lta ma yin na ni sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But it is not that the other factors are not associated with the mind.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then they would not be associated with the mind, because they would not be associated with the mind in the same way that the mind is associated with itself.

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dang mi ldan pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dang mi ldan pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called dissociated from the mind and from thought concomitants.

original: sems ni sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems ni sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is not subject to the consequence of being dissociated, because it is associated with thought concomitants.

original: de ltar na bstan pa 'di dag gi bshad pa bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa 'di dag gi bshad pa bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: Thus, the explanation of these teachings must be undertaken.

original: de la re zhig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la re zhig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: In this regard, the word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù is mentioned.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar bar bya ba'i don du ste /üîΩde la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar bar bya ba'i don du ste / de la ste /
translated: In this regard means in order to specify.

original: de dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la'o //
translated: In this regard means in those.

original: re zhig gi sgra ni rim gyi don du ste /
analyzed: re zhig gi sgra ni rim gyi don du ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù has the meaning of sequence.

original: cig car bshad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car bshad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to explain them all at once.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: Obtaining is the word of the teaching.

original: rnyed dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rnyed dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig go //
translated: Possessing is the word of the explanation.

original: thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa'i sgra don gcig par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa'i sgra don gcig par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although the words obtaining, acquiring, and possessing are held to have the same meaning,

original: 'on kyang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, acquiring and possessing are taught as distinct.

original: sngar ma thob pa rnams kyi thob pa gang dag yin pa de ni zhes khyad bar du bstan te /
analyzed: sngar ma thob pa rnams kyi thob pa gang dag yin pa de ni zhes khyad bar du bstan te /
translated: Obtaining that which was not previously obtained is taught as a distinction.

analyzed: nangs kyi dang por thob pa skyes pa ni rnyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is obtained at the beginning is acquiring, because it is generated.

original: @151a * // thob zin pa rnams kyi thob ba gang zhig skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yod pa de ni ldan pa ste /
analyzed: @151a * // thob zin pa rnams kyi thob ba gang zhig skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yod pa de ni ldan pa ste /
translated: Obtaining that which has already been obtained exists in the second moment and so on, and that is possessing.

original: kun du rjes su 'gro ba ni ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rjes su 'gro ba ni ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because possessing is the universal accompaniment of that.üîΩTherefore, the word obtaining is used for acquiring and possessing.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na thob pa'i sgra ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na thob pa'i sgra ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la 'jug go //
translated: Obtaining is twofold:üîΩobtaining that which was not previously obtained andüîΩobtaining that which was previously obtained.üîΩObtaining that which was not previously obtained is called acquiring.üîΩObtaining that which was previously obtained is called possessing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩthob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes rgyas par smos so ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes rgyas par smos so ;
translated: Therefore,üîΩObtainment is twofold.

original: / ma thob pa ste sngar nam yang ma thob pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par nyams pa ste thob nas sa 'phos pa dang / yongs su nyams pa la sogs pas btang ba las nangs kyi dang por thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: / ma thob pa ste sngar nam yang ma thob pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par nyams pa ste thob nas sa 'phos pa dang / yongs su nyams pa la sogs pas btang ba las nangs kyi dang por thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: Obtainment is twofold: nonobtainment and obtainment. Nonobtainment is that which has never been obtained before. Obtainment is that which is obtained after losing it through relocating to another level, through complete degeneration and so on.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na ni thob nas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na ni thob nas ldan pa'o //
translated: Obtainment is obtained for the first time and then one possesses it in the second moment and so on.

analyzed: 'on te mdo gzhan las yin / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni gcig tu ni ldan pa dbang ba nyid yin la /

original: @153a * // da ltar ba dag kho na la dbang ba nyid 'thad de /

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni yod de /

analyzed: de'i phyir de med kyang skye ba mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par smras pa yin no zhe na /

original: de'i tshe skye ba'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, the text says, ‚ÄúIf you say that they are the cause of the obtainment that arises simultaneously with them, then at that time, the obtainment and the object obtained would arise simultaneously.‚Äù

original: gal te chos lhan cig skyes pa thob pa'i rgyu can yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos lhan cig skyes pa thob pa'i rgyu can yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig skyed par 'gyur /
translated: If it is the cause of obtaining a simultaneously arisen phenomenon, then what does it generate?

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa ni skyed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa ni skyed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the result of arising is the generation of that which is not yet arisen.

original: gal te thob pa skyed par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thob pa skyed par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur te /

original: gnas pa la sogs pa ltar de la byed pas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa ltar de la byed pas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like enduring and so on, it has no other function.

original: des na de yongs su brtags pa don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de yongs su brtags pa don med par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore it would be pointless to impute it.

analyzed: yang na chos rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba khas blang bar mi bya'o // ci ste skye ba don med par 'gyur du 'ong bas de'i phyir thob pas skye ba skyed par byed la /
translated: Or else, you should not accept that the reason for obtaining simultaneously arisen phenomena is arising.üîΩBut if you think that because it would be pointless, arising generates obtaining and obtaining generates arising,

original: skye bas chos skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: skye bas chos skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod do snyam na /

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúarising of arising‚Äù is stated.

original: ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: What would it do?

original: gal te thob pas skye ba skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: gal te thob pas skye ba skyed par byed kyi /
translated: If arising generates the acquisition of arising,

original: skye ba'i skye bas ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ma yin no //
translated: not the arising of arising.

original: de ltar na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the investigation of the characteristics of the primary elements would be pointless.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Those who possess all the bonds, etc.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Those who possess all the bonds are those who have not abandoned even one type of affliction.

original: gang gi phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par thob pa la khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par thob pa la khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is no difference in the acquisition of the acquisition of the bonds, there would be no difference in the arising of the afflictions of those who possess all the bonds, those who possess small and medium bonds, and those who possess small bonds.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i thob pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i thob pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no distinction in the acquisition that is the cause of those afflictions.

original: gzhan dag na re ne rgyud gzhan la ltos na thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ne rgyud gzhan la ltos na thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others say: Because there is no distinction in obtainment in dependence on other lineages.

original: 'di ltar 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyi thob pa rnams mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyi thob pa rnams mtshungs te /
translated: Thus the obtainment of all those who possess all the bonds is similar.

original: nyon mongs pa chung du'i chung du rnams kyi thob pa chung du'i chung du yin pa nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung du'i chung du rnams kyi thob pa chung du'i chung du yin pa nas /
translated: The smallest obtainment is that of the smallest of the small afflictions and so on.

original: chen po'i chen po rnams kyi thob pa chen po'i chen po'i par kho na yin pas /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po rnams kyi thob pa chen po'i chen po'i par kho na yin pas /
translated: The greatest obtainment is that of the greatest of the great afflictions.

original: thams cad kyi thob pa bye brag med pa dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba'i khyad par du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thob pa bye brag med pa dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba'i khyad par du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no distinction in obtainment, how could there be a distinction in the arising of the small, medium and great afflictions of Devadatta and so on?

original: rgyu la bye brag med na 'bras bu'i bye brag mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu la bye brag med na 'bras bu'i bye brag mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: If there is no distinction in the cause, it is illogical that there is a distinction in the result.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'ching ba dang bral ba rnams @154b la chung ngu la sogs pa'i khyad par du nyon mongs pa skye ba'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'ching ba dang bral ba rnams @154b la chung ngu la sogs pa'i khyad par du nyon mongs pa skye ba'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who possess all the bonds‚Äù is mentioned because there is an opportunity for the arising of the lesser and other types of moral defilement in those who are free from the bonds.

original: ci ste thob pa la bye brag med kyang goms pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan las nyon mongs pa skye ba khyad par du 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste thob pa la bye brag med kyang goms pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan las nyon mongs pa skye ba khyad par du 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
translated: If you think that this fault does not arise because the moral defilements arise from other causes, such as the repeated practice of the latter, even though there is no distinction in the acquisition of the latter,

original: de'i phyir / de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩgoms pa'am gzhan las chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba de kho na las de dag skye la rag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so // goms pa'am gzhan las chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba de kho na las de dag skye la rag ste /
translated: then he says: ‚Äúif there were a distinction in them from that‚Äù.üîΩThe lesser, medium and greater nature of the moral defilements would arise from that alone, i.e. from the repeated practice of the latter or from other causes.

original: rgyu gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa'i khyad par yongs su brtags pa de kho na las nyon mongs pa rnams chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid du skye la rag mod /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa'i khyad par yongs su brtags pa de kho na las nyon mongs pa rnams chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid du skye la rag mod /
translated: However, the distinction of the moral defilements is imagined to arise from some other cause, and the moral defilements would arise as lesser, medium and greater from that alone.

original: thob pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba yongs su brtags pa ci dgos /
analyzed: thob pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba yongs su brtags pa ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to imagine that the possession is something else?

original: de skad du su zer zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad du su zer zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Who says this?

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cause of the classification is the cause of the determination.

original: re zhig so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin pas de dag la khyad par du byas pa don med do //
analyzed: re zhig so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin pas de dag la khyad par du byas pa don med do //
translated: Since ordinary beings possess a mundane mind, it is pointless to specify them.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: When noble ones manifest the supramundane path, they possess a supramundane mind.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äúpossessing a mundane mind.‚Äù

original: yid ni yid nyid do //
analyzed: yid ni yid nyid do //
translated: The mind is the nature of mind.

original: lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe ni thob pa med par yang 'phags pa so so'i skye bo'i rnam par gzhag par bya bar nus te /
analyzed: lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe ni thob pa med par yang 'phags pa so so'i skye bo'i rnam par gzhag par bya bar nus te /
translated: When the path is manifested, it is possible to classify noble ones as ordinary beings without possession,

original: lam nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path itself is the cause of the classification.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams la ni thob pa med par 'di dag ni 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams la ni thob pa med par 'di dag ni 'phags pa'o //
translated: But those who possess mundane thought do not possess obtainment, and it would not be possible to posit that these are ƒÅryas and these are ordinary beings.

original: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'o zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur na 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'o zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur na 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa yod pa dang / de med pa ni 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa yod pa dang / de med pa ni 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore it is certain that the existence and nonexistence of obtainment of the uncontaminated path is the cause for positing ƒÅryas and ordinary beings.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: ‚ÄúThat is unacceptable because it is illogical for a substantially existent phenomenon to exist.‚Äù

original: thob pa ni chos thob zin pa chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa ni chos thob zin pa chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtainment is the cause for the nondissipation of already obtained phenomena.

original: thob zin pa'i chos chud mi za ba'i rgyu ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: thob zin pa'i chos chud mi za ba'i rgyu ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The cause for the nondissipation of already obtained phenomena is called the cause of existence.

original: thob pa'i dbang gis ni chos de dag 'gags pa dang / ma skyes kyang yod do zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: thob pa'i dbang gis ni chos de dag 'gags pa dang / ma skyes kyang yod do zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Due to obtainment, those phenomena are said to exist even though they have ceased or have not yet arisen.

original: 'di ni 'di'o snyam pa'i shes pa'i rtags mtshan yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'o snyam pa'i shes pa'i rtags mtshan yang yin te /
translated: It is also the sign of the cognition that thinks, This is that.üîΩThe cognition that thinks, This is related to that,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos gzhan pa'i 'di ni 'di'i 'brel pa can yin no snyam du 'brel pa can gyi shes pa @155a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos gzhan pa'i 'di ni 'di'i 'brel pa can yin no snyam du 'brel pa can gyi shes pa @155a * //
translated: arises in regard to other phenomena such as attachment, etc., and it is related to that.

original: skye ba gang yin pa de ni rtags mtshan du gyur pa'i thob pa yod na yin te /
analyzed: skye ba gang yin pa de ni rtags mtshan du gyur pa'i thob pa yod na yin te /
translated: That cognition is the sign of the obtainment of that which is related to attachment, etc.,

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa na 'brel pa can gyi shes pa'i rtags su gyur pa'i thob pa med pa dang / de dag 'brel pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa na 'brel pa can gyi shes pa'i rtags su gyur pa'i thob pa med pa dang / de dag 'brel pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Otherwise, when attachment, etc., are stopped or not yet arisen, the obtainment of the sign of the cognition that is related to that would not exist, and that which is the cognition that is related to that would not be that.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las 'gyur bar 'os so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las 'gyur bar 'os so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is proper that it arises from the distinction of the abandonment or nonabandonment of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dag gi dngos po ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dag gi dngos po ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa nyid de /
translated: The state of the abandonment or nonabandonment of affliction is the abandonment or nonabandonment of affliction.

original: de nyid bye brag yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bye brag yin no //
translated: This is the distinction.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas bton pa las nyon mongs pa rnams yang mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas bton pa las nyon mongs pa rnams yang mi skye ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements is the non-rebirth of the defilements due to the uprooting of the seeds of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas ma bton pa las nyon mongs pa yang skye ba srid pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas ma bton pa las nyon mongs pa yang skye ba srid pa'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of the defilements is the possibility of the rebirth of the defilements due to the non-uprooting of the seeds of the defilements.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin yang gang dag la sa bon med pas nyon mongs nam yang mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa de dag ni 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin yang gang dag la sa bon med pas nyon mongs nam yang mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa de dag ni 'phags pa yin la /
translated: Thus, although they possess the mundane mental faculty, those who have the nature of never again producing the defilements because the seeds are absent are ƒÅryas.

original: gang dag la sa bon rgyun ma bcad pas yang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni so so'i skye bo yin pas rnam par gzhag pa grub bo //
analyzed: gang dag la sa bon rgyun ma bcad pas yang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni so so'i skye bo yin pas rnam par gzhag pa grub bo //
translated: Those in whom the seeds are not interrupted and can be produced again are ordinary persons. Thus, the establishment is proven.

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThese have abandoned the defilements,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams las gang las 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //üîΩ'di dag ni ma spangs pa'o zhes ma spangs pa'o sbar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams las gang las 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o // 'di dag ni ma spangs pa'o zhes ma spangs pa'o sbar 'gyur ba /
translated: Thus, there is no basis for positing the distinction between ƒÅryas and ordinary beings, since there is no sign of the abandonment or non-abandonment of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i rtags mtshan cung zad kyang med de /üîΩde'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa'o ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i rtags mtshan cung zad kyang med de / de'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa'o ;
translated: There is not the slightest sign of the abandonment or non-abandonment of the afflictions.üîΩTherefore, since the abandonment or non-abandonment of the afflictions is not understood, the distinction between ƒÅryas and ordinary beings who possess mundane minds remains as it is.

original: /'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa so na 'dug go //üîΩthob pa yod na ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: /'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa so na 'dug go // thob pa yod na ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: There is no such distinction.

original: 'di dag ni ma spangs pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma spangs pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were obtainment, then there would be the distinction between those who have abandoned the afflictions and those who have not.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir / de dang bral ba dang ma bral ba las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dang bral ba dang ma bral ba las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúdue to being free or not free from that.‚Äù

original: gang dag gi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams dang mi ldan pa dang / rnam par chad pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams dang mi ldan pa dang / rnam par chad pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Those whose mindstreams are not endowed with the obtainment of the afflictions and those whose mindstreams are severed are those who have abandoned the afflictions.

original: gang dag gi rgyud ma bral ba dang rgyun ma chad pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'o //üîΩ'di ni rten gyi bye brag las grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rgyud ma bral ba dang rgyun ma chad pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'o // 'di ni rten gyi bye brag las grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Those whose mindstreams are not free from the afflictions and those whose mindstreams are not severed are those who have not abandoned the afflictions.

original: 'di dag ni ma spangs @155b pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma spangs @155b pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is established by the distinction of the basis means that these are those who have abandoned the afflictions and these are those who have not abandoned the afflictions.

original: 'dir rten ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dir rten ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: Here the basis is the five aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say it is the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bo dag dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dag gi rten gyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang / so so'i skye bo dag dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dag gi rten gyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinction of the basis of ƒÅryas and ordinary beings, those who have abandoned the afflictions and those who have not abandoned the afflictions,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas ni zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so ;
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas ni zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so ;
translated: he says, The basis of the ƒÅryas, etc.

original: /'phags pa'i lam la skyes pa'i rten ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rten gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas gnas skabs der ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: /'phags pa'i lam la skyes pa'i rten ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rten gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas gnas skabs der ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya ste /
translated: The basis of the ƒÅrya path is the basis that is related to the seeds of the afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation. It is the cause of the other basis. At that stage, it is called an ordinary being.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skad cig gzhan skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skad cig gzhan skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of one who has generated the ƒÅrya path is the basis that is related to the seeds of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation. It is called an ordinary being because it generates another moment that is related to the seeds of all the afflictions of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam mam bsgom pa'i lam mngon du 'gyur la /üîΩde mngon du gyur na rten de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam mam bsgom pa'i lam mngon du 'gyur la / de mngon du gyur na rten de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The antidote to the afflictions is either the path of seeing or the path of cultivation.

original: de skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rkyen thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When that is manifest, the basis does not generate another moment that is related to the seeds of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by those paths because it obtains the conditions that are incompatible with its generation.

original: de'i phyir rten des mthong ba dang bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten des mthong ba dang bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang skyed par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, that basis is unable to generate the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation,

original: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seeds do not exist.

original: sa bon med pa rnams ni skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: sa bon med pa rnams ni skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that those without seeds arise,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to the absurd conclusion that anything could arise from anything.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyun chad pa las mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthus ji ltar de dag gis nub par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang 'byung bar mi nus ba de ltar gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyun chad pa las mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthus ji ltar de dag gis nub par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang 'byung bar mi nus ba de ltar gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te

analyzed: 'dir yang 'bras bu che ba dag gi phyogs gcig na 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod de /

original: gnas de ni ches mchog tu gyur pa zhig go //
analyzed: gnas de ni ches mchog tu gyur pa zhig go //
translated: That place is the most excellent.

original: de rnams las gang gis de ris mthun par 'phangs pa dang / sems gang gis mtshams sbyar ba dang / sems gang zhig gi mjug thogs su 'du shes med pa par 'jug pa /
analyzed: de rnams las gang gis de ris mthun par 'phangs pa dang / sems gang gis mtshams sbyar ba dang / sems gang zhig gi mjug thogs su 'du shes med pa par 'jug pa /
translated: Those who are projected into that realm by any karma, who are connected to that realm by any mind, and who enter the state of non discernment immediately after any mind

original: las dang / skye ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi zas dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: las dang / skye ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi zas dang ldan pa rnams te /

original: des na de dag gi reg pa la sogs pa dag gis zas dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag gi reg pa la sogs pa dag gis zas dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, their contact and so on possess food.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la ni sngar zas zos pa las reg pa la @166a * //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la ni sngar zas zos pa las reg pa la @166a * //

original: sogs pa dag gis zas kyi bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: sogs pa dag gis zas kyi bya ba byed kyi /
translated: and so on refers to the function of food,

original: dus da ltar nye bar rton pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus da ltar nye bar rton pa las ni ma yin no //

original: sems dang bcas pa rnams la ni gnyis ka ltar yang yin no //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa rnams la ni gnyis ka ltar yang yin no //

original: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

original: sems med pa'i gnas skabs phal che ba'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnas skabs phal che ba'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams zhes brjod de /
translated: They are called beings devoid of discernment because they are devoid of discernment for the most part.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las sems can de dag ni 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las sems can de dag ni 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those sentient beings die and transmigrate from that state when discernment arises.

original: dus ring mo zhig tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig tu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus ring mo zhig tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig tu ma yin pa'o //
translated: For a long time means not for a single moment.

original: skye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'du shes can du 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'du shes can du 'gyur /

original: shi 'phos nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'phos nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And they are born in the desire realm after death.

original: sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the formative forces of prior meditative attainment are exhausted.

original: de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the life force projected by the mind of meditative attainment is exhausted.

original: sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Because the prior non-existent is not accumulated.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba med par ni las dag nye bar sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba med par ni las dag nye bar sogs pa ma yin te /
