original: sems pa dang bsam pa'i las zhes byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang bsam pa'i las zhes byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that karma is intention and the karma of intention.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for the statement, ‚ÄúOne is born in the desire realm‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig der skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig der skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúOne who is born there‚Äù and so on.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba'i las bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba'i las bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the karma to be experienced in the desire realm of the beings devoid of discernment is definite, like the karma for birth as a god of the northern Kuru.

original: yang snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, it is said that the meditative attainments are pure.

original: gang las bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang las bshad ce na /
translated: From what is this said?üîΩFrom the Abhidharma S≈´tra:

original: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes shes med snyoms 'jug dang // ces bstan ba'i mdo las so //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes shes med snyoms 'jug dang // ces bstan ba'i mdo las so //
translated: Obtainment, nonobtainment, homogeneity,üîΩthe meditative attainment of nondiscernment, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment,

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa pa'i rgyu yin par sngar bstan pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa pa'i rgyu yin par sngar bstan pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment have been explained as the cause of beings devoid of discernment.üîΩThe question is asked:

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa ;
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa ;
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used because it is related to the previous.

original: ji ltar gang las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de la 'du shes med pa pa zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gang las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de la 'du shes med pa pa zhes bshad pa /
translated: Just as it was explained that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the cause of beings devoid of discernment,

original: de bzhin du /üîΩ'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du / 'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: so too,üîΩthe meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the meditative attainment of beings devoid of discernment.

original: gang dag der snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag der snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who enter that meditative attainment are beings devoid of discernment.

original: 'du @166b shes med pa can yin pas zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang sbyar te /üîΩ'di la 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'du @166b shes med pa can yin pas zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang sbyar te / 'di la 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is called the meditative attainment of nonperception because it is devoid of discernment.üîΩIt is called the meditative attainment of nonperception because it is devoid of discernment.

original: yang dag pa dang te por snyoms par 'jug pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang te por snyoms par 'jug pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is called the meditative attainment of nonperception because it is the attainment of nonperception.

original: rigs pas yang dag par sgrub pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas yang dag par sgrub pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the correct establishment of meditative equipoise.

original: gzhan dag na re ni sems dang 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrubs pas na snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩde bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'dren to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni sems dang 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrubs pas na snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes zer ro // de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'dren to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others say: It is called the meditative attainment of nonperception because it is the attainment of the equality of mind and the great elements.üîΩThe term ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates that only that much is similar.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyi tsam zhig kho na mthun par 'dren gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyi tsam zhig kho na mthun par 'dren gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates that only that much is similar,

original: khyad par ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
translated: but it does not indicate a specific similarity.

original: gnyis ka yang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i gegs kyi bdag nyid du mtshungs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i gegs kyi bdag nyid du mtshungs te /
translated: Both are similar in that they are the cessation of future minds and mental factors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that they are the cessation of minds and mental factors.

original: bsam gtan tha mar zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan tha mar zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the final meditative absorption‚Äù is used because

original: bsam gtan bzhi bas bsdus pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi bas bsdus pa'o ;
translated: they are included in the fourth meditative absorption.

original: ; bsam gtan bzhi la smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; bsam gtan bzhi la smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth meditative absorption is mentioned in order to clarify the meditative absorptions and formless states that are other than that.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni tshor ba la chags pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni tshor ba la chags pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug na /
translated: If ordinary beings enter the meditative absorptions and formless states because they are attached to feelings,

original: de na ni tshor ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de na ni tshor ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: then feelings do not exist in those states. Therefore, the question is asked,

original: ci'i phyir 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy do they enter this state?‚Äù

original: 'byung 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they desire to be reborn‚Äù is used because

original: de dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa la lam du 'du shes shing /
analyzed: de dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa la lam du 'du shes shing /
translated: they perceive the meditative absorptions as a path.

original: 'du shes med pa pa la thar bar 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa la thar bar 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: One imagines that the state of nonperception is liberation.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: The state of nonperception is karmic maturation, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Karmic maturation is a neutral factor.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir dge ba yin gyi /
translated: This meditative attainment is wholesome because it is included within the realm of fine-materiality.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not unwholesome or neutral.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi nang du phung po lnga 'grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi nang du phung po lnga 'grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its karmic maturation is the establishment of the five aggregates in the realm of the sentient beings devoid of ideation, because at the time of birth and death, mind and mental factors are present.

original: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bya ba ni mtshams med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bya ba ni mtshams med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is to be experienced after rebirth, like the four actions of immediate consequence.

original: de thob pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de thob pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Obtaining this meditative attainment, one is born among the sentient beings devoid of ideation.

original: yongs su nyams pa na bdag nyid phan pa las nyams par sems shing skyo ba drag po 'byung ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa na bdag nyid phan pa las nyams par sems shing skyo ba drag po 'byung ste /
translated: When one regresses, one thinks that one has lost a benefit and a strong feeling of regret arises.

original: de'i phyir de skyed @167a * //üîΩpa kho na la gus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de skyed @167a * // pa kho na la gus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one does not generate the path to nirvana.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du mthong bas rlom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du mthong bas rlom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not a disciple of the Buddhas because one is proud, having seen the cessation of suffering.üîΩTherefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir / gang gis 'di skyes nas yongs su nyams pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gis 'di skyes nas yongs su nyams pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who generates that but then regresses‚Äù and so on.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthey say‚Äù indicates that this is another opinion.

original: gzhan dag na re ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar ma nges pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar ma nges pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is also experienced after rebirth and is not definitely experienced.

original: yongs su nyams sam yongs su ma nyams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams sam yongs su ma nyams kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one regresses or does not regress,

original: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las skyon du lta bar gyur na ni de nas nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur la ;
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las skyon du lta bar gyur na ni de nas nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur la ;
translated: if one sees the faults of the desire realm through meeting a spiritual teacher, one then enters the fixed condition.

original: zhugs pa na yang skyed par mi byed cing mngon du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: zhugs pa na yang skyed par mi byed cing mngon du yang mi byed do //
translated: When they enter it, they do not generate it, nor do they manifest it.

original: so so'i skye bo kho na yin par 'dod kyi /üîΩ'phags pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo kho na yin par 'dod kyi / 'phags pa'i ma yin /
translated: They are ordinary beings, not noble ones.

original: nges pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams kyis ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang / 'du shes med pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skyes pa rnams kyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: nges pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams kyis ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang / 'du shes med pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skyes pa rnams kyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob ste /
translated: Noble ones who have entered the certainty of perfection obtain the nondiscernment attainment of the formless realm and the nondiscernment attainment of the Brahma realm, but not the nondiscernment attainment of the first meditative stabilization.

analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the afflicted view of the self and because it is incompatible with the noble path.

original: des na rnam par ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas snyoms par mi 'jug go //
analyzed: des na rnam par ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas snyoms par mi 'jug go //

original: 'phags pa rnams ni srid pa la nges par 'byung bar 'du shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni srid pa la nges par 'byung bar 'du shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Noble ones do not consider existence to be a refuge,

original: thar pa dang / thar pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa dang / thar pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they directly perceive liberation and the path to liberation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan bzhin du 'di 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag kyang thob bam zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas 'khor ba thog ma med par sngon thob thob pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa 'das pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan bzhin du 'di 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag kyang thob bam zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas 'khor ba thog ma med par sngon thob thob pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa 'das pa dang /
translated: Having obtained the fourth absorption, they ask, Do they obtain past and future absorptions like the present?üîΩYogis who obtain the fourth absorption ask, Do they obtain past and future absorptions that were obtained in the past in cyclic existence without beginning, like the present absorption?

original: ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa de'i phyir na ci de dang 'dra bar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa 'thob bam zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa de'i phyir na ci de dang 'dra bar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa 'thob bam zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: Do they obtain past and future absorptions in the same way?

original: re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Others do not obtain it either,

original: gang dag mngon du byed cing don du gnyer ba dang / gang dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa bdag gi ba yin pa'i so so'i skye bo dag gis kyang mi thob na /
analyzed: gang dag mngon du byed cing don du gnyer ba dang / gang dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa bdag gi ba yin pa'i so so'i skye bo dag gis kyang mi thob na /
translated: because ordinary beings who manifest and pursue the absorptions and who possess the meditative attainment of the absorptions do not obtain it.

original: 'di gang dag gi bdag gi ba ma yin pa 'phags pa rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'di gang dag gi bdag gi ba ma yin pa 'phags pa rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that aryas do not obtain it?

original: 'dres pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med par sngon thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med par sngon thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is familiar‚Äù means that it was previously obtained in beginningless samsara.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i @167b tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i @167b tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is accomplished through great effort‚Äù means that it is accomplished through great exertion.

original: de'i phyir 'dris kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dris kyang /
translated: Therefore, even if it is familiar,

original: ma brtsal bar mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: ma brtsal bar mi 'thob bo //
translated: it is not obtained without effort.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: mdo gzhan las tshor ba khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las tshor ba khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because feeling is distinguished in another s≈´tra.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from contact associated with ignorance,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma rig pa dang 'brel pa'i reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'brel pa'i reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Contact associated with ignorance is contact associated with ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen from contact associated with ignorance is arisen from contact associated with ignorance.

original: de ltar sred pa skye ba la tshor ba ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sred pa skye ba la tshor ba ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the arising of craving is distinguished by the fact that it arises from contact that is the coming together of feeling and ignorance.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba ni srid pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba ni srid pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to prove that feeling that is not associated with ignorance is the condition of existence.

original: tshor ba skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúthe arising of feeling,‚Äù etc.,

original: reg pa 'di 'dra ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: reg pa 'di 'dra ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin la /
translated: it is not specified that contact that is like this is the condition of feeling,

original: 'di 'dra ba ni ma yin zhes bye brag tu ma byas te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni ma yin zhes bye brag tu ma byas te /
translated: but that contact that is like that is not.

original: de'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar blangs pa'i phyir reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen yin pas dpe 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag med par nye bar blangs pa'i phyir reg pa thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen yin pas dpe 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since contact is accepted without distinction, all contact is the condition of feeling. Thus, this example is not the same.

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the meditative attainment of cessation is mindless.

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dang bcas pa dge ba ni sems dang sems las byung brtse gcig par grub pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du rung gi / gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams te 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dang bcas pa dge ba ni sems dang sems las byung brtse gcig par grub pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du rung gi / gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams te 'dri ba ni /
translated: It is not suitable to be meditative attainment in any other way.üîΩThe question is asked:

original: ji ltar na sems med pa na snyoms par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems med pa na snyoms par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is there meditative attainment when there is no mind?

original: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to establish the sameness of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ma nyam pa nyid ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ma nyam pa nyid ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa gnas pa ste /
translated: The sameness of the great elements is the abiding that is incompatible with the generation of mind and mental factors.

original: de bsgrub pa ni de ltar byed pa'o //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kho na 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni de ltar byed pa'o // snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kho na 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
translated: To establish that is to make it so.

original: lus dang sems dag phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is the preparation for meditative attainment establishes the sameness of the great elements because it makes the body and mind mutually compatible.

original: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can nyid yin te /
translated: Others say: The sameness of the great elements is the state of being undestroyed.

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnod pa med pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: Thus the meditative attainment of cessation is the state of being undestroyed.

original: yang na sems kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sems kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Or, the meditative attainment of cessation is entered by the mind because it is entered by the mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang sems gnyis lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang sems gnyis lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it entered, since it is contradictory for both the mind and meditative attainment to exist simultaneously?

original: de'i phyir thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'di ltar snyoms par 'jug @174a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba smos te / 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug @174a * //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is obtained,‚Äù

original: pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba dang 'gal ba 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba dang 'gal ba 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren pa yin no //
translated: because the mind that is the basis of the meditative attainment of cessation is the mind that induces the meditative attainment of cessation, which is incompatible with the occurrence of minds and mental factors.

original: sems skye ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems skye ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that it is entered because it obstructs the arising of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chu bab pas la chu lon ltar dus gzhan gyi bar du sems skye ba la gegs byed pa zhig ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni chu bab pas la chu lon ltar dus gzhan gyi bar du sems skye ba la gegs byed pa zhig ste /
translated: Because the meditative attainment of cessation is like a dam that blocks the arising of mind for a period of time.

original: med pa ni sems skye ba'i gegs byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa ni sems skye ba'i gegs byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could a non-existent state block the arising of mind?

original: 'jug bzhin pa'i sems mi 'jug pa ni rgyu zad pa 'am de 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir nye ba las yin grang /
analyzed: 'jug bzhin pa'i sems mi 'jug pa ni rgyu zad pa 'am de 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir nye ba las yin grang /
translated: When mind that is engaged does not engage, it is due to the exhaustion of its cause or due to the arising of something incompatible with it.

original: de re zhig rgyu zad pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de re zhig rgyu zad pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to the exhaustion of its cause,

original: yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it arises again.

original: / de'i phyir 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs la /
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs la /
translated: Therefore it is understood that it is created by another condition that is incompatible with it.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen gang yin pa de yang 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen gang yin pa de yang 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And that which is an incompatible condition is the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho nas de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho nas de la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the mind of meditative attainment itself blocks it.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa de'i tshe sems mi 'jug pa ni bden na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa de'i tshe sems mi 'jug pa ni bden na /
translated: If it is true that mind does not engage when it is created by another incompatible condition,üîΩthen it is not tenable that the meditative attainment of cessation is a meditative attainment.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen de ni sems gzhan skye ba dang 'gal ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen de ni sems gzhan skye ba dang 'gal ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi /
translated: The opposing condition is the mind of meditative attainment alone, which is incompatible with the arising of other minds.
